description: Hygiene education in the United States focused primarily on cleanliness, immorality, and sexually transmitted diseases.
Ella Flagg Young, the superintendent of Chicago Public Schools was the first to attempt implementing a city-wide sex-hygiene program in secondary schools.
Fighting against venereal disease was a matter of national security.
US joins World War 1
The U.S. Department of Labor's Children's Bureau released a report suggesting sex education during school could have better protected soldiers from STIs.
Education on development reached it's greatest popularity.
The Great Depression and then US joined WW2
Marriage courses started to appear in colleges and address human sexuality among other practical matters.
The Kinsey Report challenged norms by establishing sex research as a field and sparking discourse on the variety and frequency of sexual behavior.
Pioneering homophile groups were formed to provide unity, awareness, and address discrimination.
Cold war
Mass dissmal of homosexual employees from the federal government, known as the Lavender Scare.
Sexuality Information and Education Council of the US (SIECUS) was founded by Mary Calderone.
The Civil Rights Act of 1964 outlawed public segregation and employment discrmination including on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, and age.
Police raids at a gay bar called Stonewall Inn in NYC sparked riots and protests that are considered the beginning of the modern pride movement.
The first edition of Our Bodies, Ourselves booklet was published to encourgae woman to have a say in their own health care and sexuality.

Title IX passed stating: “No person in the United States shall, on the basis of sex, be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be subjected to discrimination under any education program or activity receiving Federal financial assistance.”
The Supreme Court case Roe v. Wade established a constitutional right to abortion in the US.
Homosexuality was declassified as disorder by the American Psychiatric Association.
Anita Bryant's anti-gay “Save Our Children“ campaign organized opposition to the movement for lesbian and gay rights.
Abstinence-only until marriage funding began federally with the Adolescent Family Life Act.
The global pandemic of HIV/AIDS began in 1981, and continues to be a public health issue with sexual contact as a primary mode of transmission.
ACT UP protests led by the AIDS Coalition to Unleash Power, a grassroots organization, demand access to treatments and research funding to end the AIDS crisis.
Most states mandate AIDS education. Cultural messaging and school-based curricula shift toward risk reduction.
The Defense of Marriage Act restricts federal marriage benefits to heterosexual couples.
U.S. Surgeon General David Satcher calls for comprehensive sex education.
The Supreme Court case Lawrence v. Texas invalidated sodomy laws across the US and recognized a fundamental right to engage in private, consensual sexual conduct between adults.
Tanya McCloskey and Marcia Kadish were the first same-sex couple to get legally married in the US in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
Asexual visibility rose with AVEN (Asexual Visibility & Education Network) gaining traction. Advocates created 'Ace Week' and push for inclusion in queer spaces and sex ed.
Transgender visibility rises nationally with increasing media attention and policy shifts.
The Supreme Court case Obergefell v. Hodges overruled a prior decision in Baker v. Nelson and required states to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples and recognize same-sex marriages.
altText: celebration with a couple kissing in front of white house

description: California was the first US state to mandate inclusive comprehensive sex ed as part of the California Healthy Youth Act. It required affirmative recognition of different sexual orientations and gender identities.
Obama-era Title IX guidance clarified protections for trans students — including access to bathrooms in schools.

Trump rescinded guidance that Title IX applied to discrimination based on gender identity, removing protections for trans youth. This fluctuation of protections continues with recent Biden and Trump administrations.
U.N. and WHO released updated guidelines supporting comprehensive sexuality education, which are internationally endorsed but not adopted by the US.
COVID-19 pandemic begins
The Supreme Court rules in a collection of cases called Bostock v. Clayton County that the Civil Rights Act of 1964 extends to discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.
Polarization over sex ed, race, and LGBTQ+ issues in schools intensifies including “Don't Say Gay” laws and societal debates about curriculum content.
The Supreme Court case Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization overturned the federal right to abortion that Roe v. Wade had established.
